events.1675: Guru Tegh Bahadur was beheaded in Delhi by Aurangzeb for his refusal to embrace him.
events.1749: Shahu Chattrapati, grandson of Shivaji, died.
events.1803: East India Company captured Orrisa state.
events.1859: S. Kasturiranga Ayengar, owner of Hindu newspaper, was born.
events.1894: Saraswatibai, famous singer and classical music expert, was born.
events.1908: Swami Ranga Natahananda, was born at Trikkur, Kerala.
events.1912: Aspy Merwan, engineer and who became the Air Marchal of India, was born.
events.1932: Tirunellai Narayana Iyer Seshan, Chief Election Commissioner of India, was born.
events.1943: The Vengeance suffered numerous defects and teething troubles, necessitating temporary withdrawal from the two IAF squadrons, but the problems were eventually mitigated if not eradicated, and No. 8 Sqn flew its first operational Vengeance sorties against Japanese targets from Double Moorings, Chittagong.
events.1950: Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel, first deputy Prime Minister of independent India also known as the 'Iron Man' and Bharat Ratna awardee, died.
events.1957: 60 Harijans enter the Vishwanath Temple at Varanasi.
events.1965: Maharastra State Agriculture Industry Development Corporation established.
events.1974: Rasulatbai, veteran classical music expert, died.
events.1976: Daily newspaper "Lokmat" published it's first Jalgaon edition.
events.1980: Hema Chengkalath, female Soccer(Football) player, was born in Calgary, Canada.
events.1988: Landslide victory for GNLF in Darjeeling Gorkha Hill Council elections.
events.1991: Satyajit Ray, film maestro, awarded Special Oscar for his lifetime achievement.
events.1992: BJP Governments of Sunderlal Patwa (MP), Shanta Kumar (HP) and Bhairon Singh Shekhawat (Rajasthan) dismissed.
events.1995: Rajya Sabha approves extension of President's rule in J & K for a further period of 6 months and also passes Government resolution approving imposition of President's rule in UP.
events.1997: Orissa Janata Dal unit splits with 29 of 43 Legislature Party members forming 'Biju Janata Dal'.
events.1999: Yashwant Sinha, Finance Minister, arrives in Berlin to attend G-20 meet.
